thread.title: Appalachian State beats rival Georgia Southern 31-13
thread.title_full: Appalachian State beats rival Georgia Southern 31-13

title: Appalachian State beats rival Georgia Southern 31-13
text:
Sports Appalachian State beats rival Georgia Southern 31-13 Appalachian State running back Marcus Cox (14) breaks through the tackle of Georgia Southern defensive end Logan Hunt (91) to score a touchdown in the second quarter of an NCAA college football game at Kidd Brewer Stadium in Boone, N.C., ... more > By - Associated Press - Thursday, October 22, 2015 
BOONE, N.C. (AP) - Taylor Lamb threw for 202 yards and two touchdowns, Appalachian State scored 31 straight, and the Mountaineers beat Georgia Southern 31-13 on Thursday night for their fifth straight victory. 
Marcus Cox rushed for 83 yards and two touchdowns for Appalachian State (6-1, 3-0 Sun Belt). Simms McElfresh caught six passes for 66 yards and a touchdown. 
The Mountaineers have won 12 of their last 13 - losing to No. 6 Clemson on Sept. 12. 
Appalachian State’s defense made two interceptions, including Mondo Williams’ late in the third quarter. Three plays later, Barrett Burns caught a short pass by Lamb and ran untouched down the sideline for a 33-yard touchdown and a 24-7 lead. 
Kevin Ellison threw for 64 yards and rushed for 46 more for Georgia Southern (5-2, 3-1). Ellison capped the Eagles’ 86-yard opening drive with a 12-yard sneak. 
Georgia Southern lost its first ever Sun Belt game in 12 attempts.
